scenes.title: Deleting Instagram, gaining focus
scenes.main_point: Removing Instagram freed time and attention for intentional reading.
scenes.scene_summary: After deleting Instagram, I found more time, energy, and attention to read intentionally.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A person sits calmly on a couch at home, phone beside them showing Instagram deleted.
They read a book with a focused posture, enjoying the quiet moment.

scenes.title: Curiosity-based reading habit
scenes.main_point: Reading followed curiosity with a simple one-hour daily quota.
scenes.scene_summary: I read whatever sparked curiosity and hit a one-hour daily quota, with extras as bonus.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A person sits at a desk at home, reading from a stack of books.
A timer on the desk is set to 1:00:00, marking a simple daily routine driven by curiosity.

scenes.title: Two books and a Feynman warning
scenes.main_point: Two books led to Feynman’s principle about self-deception.
scenes.scene_summary: I read Deutsch and Holiday, and both echoed Feynman: don’t fool yourself first.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A reader sits at a desk with two books visible: The Beginning of Infinity and Ego is the Enemy.
On a nearby screen, a Richard Feynman quote reads: “The first principle is that you must not fool yourself — and you are the easiest person to fool.”

scenes.title: How high ego blocks learning
scenes.main_point: High ego creates stories, blocks beginner mindset, and avoids boring practice.
scenes.scene_summary: High ego made me fear sounding bad on guitar and resist learning from a kid.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
In a living room, an adult stands by an unused guitar, hesitating with a hand hovering over it.
Nearby, a kid sits and plays the guitar better, while the adult watches with reluctant, uneasy expression.

scenes.title: Purpose fantasies vs doing what’s needed
scenes.main_point: Chasing grand purpose can hide basic neglect; reality improves through humble work.
scenes.scene_summary: I chased world-changing purpose while neglecting basics, until I focused on what needed doing.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
One person in a small bathroom, holding a to-do list with basic chores checked off.
They scrub a toilet beside visible trash, while faded, drifting title/recognition imagery dissolves in the background; emotion: grounded focus.

scenes.title: Rejection, growth, and good explanations
scenes.main_point: Low ego and better explanations prevented self-deception; curiosity kept learning alive.
scenes.scene_summary: After hackathon rejection, I learned no-code, improved, and kept seeking better explanations with humility.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A young creator at a desk sees a hackathon rejection message on a laptop, then turns to a no-code tool interface covered with question marks.
In the same workspace, a small “Finalist / 3rd prize” note and a Galileo heliocentric sketch sit nearby, showing humble curiosity and growth.
